Ravangla is a relatively new tourist spot in South Sikkim. It is a small picturesque town on the highway from Gangtok to Gaysiling at an elevation of 8.000 ft. Ravangla is one of the few places in Sikkim which offer undisturbed views of the Greater Himalayas (Mt. Kanchenjunga, Mt. Pandim, Mt. Sinialchu, Mt. Kabru) In April and May lots of flowers are in full blossom.

Ravangla is situated about 65 km West of Gangtok and 52 Km East of Pelling.
It is directly accessible from Gangtok (65 km - 2 hrs 15 mins), Siliguri (126 km - 4 hrs 30 mins), Darjeeling and Kalimpong.

Jeeps arrive at and leave from the crossing at the Southern end of the market (Gangtok INR 80, Namchi INR 40). A few taxis go directly to Pelling (INR 80). but normally you will have to change cars at Gyalshing.

Busses to Gangtock leave at 9am, to Gyalshing at 11am. There are two busses to Namchi at 9am and 1pm. If you want to go to Darjeeling, you will have to take a bus or taxi to Jorethang first and change car at Jorethang .

The Mount Narsing Village Resort has two wings. One on the road and the other one 1 km up. THe one by the roadside is cheaper (Rs. 800-1000) but the food is just ok and so is the accommodation. The Annexe wing has suites and cottages. (Rs. 1500 - Rs 2100) and has great views of Mt. Kabru and the Narsing range. The food is quite tasty. The restaurant serves Sikkimese, Indian, Chinese and Continental cuisine.
